summary: Ottawa is Canada's capital city, located where the Ottawa and Rideau Rivers meet in Ontario. It's the fourth-largest city in Canada and is home to the Canadian government, including Parliament and the Supreme Court. Originally named Bytown, it was established in 1826 and later became Ottawa in 1855. The city has many universities, museums, and cultural attractions. Ottawa welcomes over 11 million visitors each year, boosting its economy. It has a special status as the National Capital Region.
title: Ottawa
